jcr:content.jcr:title: East Side, West Side: Tales of New York Sporting Life 1910–1960

contentheadline.headline: East Side, West Side: Tales of New York Sporting Life 1910–1960

contentrichtext.text: '''''East Side, West Side: Tales of New York Sporting Life 1910–1960''''' (ISBN 0-9656949-6-8) is a sports book written by [[Lawrence S. Ritter]] and published in 1998. It is a [[Total Sports]] production and was distributed by [[Andrews McNeel]]. The book centers, as its title suggests, on popular sports sites and figures of [[New York City|New York]] between 1910 and 1960. Among the personalities the book talks about in depth are [[Babe Ruth]], [[Lou Gehrig]], [[Joe Louis]], [[Primo Carnera]], [[Tony Canzoneri]], [[Sugar Ray Robinson]], [[Casey Stengel]], [[Mickey Mantle]], [[Joe DiMaggio]], [[Lou Stillman]], [[Jacob Ruppert]] and more. Sports covered in depth are [[baseball]], [[basketball]], [[boxing]], [[ice hockey|hockey]] and [[horse racing]], all of which were popular sports in New York during the 50 years covered by the book. {{DEFAULTSORT:East Side, West Side: Tales of New York Sporting Life 1910-1960}} [[Category:1992 books]] [[Category:Books about sports]] [[Category:Sports in New York]]
